quest.name: Manderville Men
journal: The time has come for you to do what only a Manderville can.
Having shared with you the secrets of House Manderville, Inspector Hildibrand now asks that you do what he cannot. Stand before the fallen chimera and dance as only a Manderville can.

A half-naked Highlander answers your summons and announces himself as Godbert the goldsmith. As he ponders how you came to learn the Manderville, he and Hildibrand lock eyes momentarily, causing the inspector to inexplicably flee the scene. All is explained after Godbert catches up to Hildibrand, though, as the goldsmith proceeds to berate his son in front of all present. Brushing aside his father's legitimate complaints, Hildibrand convinces Godbert to reconstruct the shattered vase. Though the results are less than ideal, perhaps Lady Durilda will be satisfied. Return to Vesper Bay so that Maria can present the vase to her mother.

Lady Durilda is dissatisfied with the vase until Godbert unexpectedly arrives and reveals that he was the one who reconstructed it. This fact, coupled with the knowledge that he, a member of the Syndicate, is also Hildibrand's father, is enough to convince the noblewoman to grant the inspector permission to assist with Briardien's investigation. Not only is Inspector Hildibrand unaware of his father's recent rise to power, he is also completely oblivious to how he personally benefited from it, as he simply states that you all must review the facts of the case with Inspector Briardien.

In between sighs and shrugs, Inspector Briardien explains his plan to lure out and catch the duelist using counterfeit Treaty-Blades being transported from Coerthas. Reluctantly, he states that you and your comrades might serve as additional “smallfolk,” watching the roads in and out of the Observatorium for anything suspicious. This suggestion pleases Inspector Hildibrand, who states with confidence that the duelist should be easy to find in snowy Coerthas, given his large frame and garish red clothing─a description he subsequently misremembers when reunited with a certain warrior and his rooster.
objectives: Give the reconstructed vase to Maria in Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: We are as siblings now, my constant comrade, for I have shared with you the secrets of House Manderville.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Now you must use that knowledge. Go to the fallen chimera and dance like only a Manderville can!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I shall maintain my distance for now, but fear not! Should aught go awry, I will fly to your side at once.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: What manner of man can be summoned only through dance?

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Are you really going to do the Manderville? Oooh, I can't wait!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text:
(-???-)Fancy yourself a Manderville man?♪
You would do what only a Manderville can?♪
Then lift your legs, and put up your hands,♪
Be a Mander-Mander-Manderville, man!♪

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: He comes!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Ho ho ho! You have naught to fear from me, naught at all! The only accounts I came to settle were with the chimera.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: But you were not drawn here by some coincidence, were you? No, you came in search of me, Godbert! Why else would you gyrate your hips in such a gentlemanly fashion, if not that?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Wait, I know you! SheHe of strong-yet-tender fingers!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: But, more importantly, how in the hells did you learn the Manderville? If I did not teach you, then who...?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: （★未使用／削除予定★）

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: By the grace of Thal, what sorcery is this? He... He yet lives!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: HILDIBRAND HELIDOR MAXIMILIAN MANDERVILLE!!!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ten years, Hildibrand, ten years since you left home! And five since I learned of your trip to Dalamud!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: How long were you planning to allow your mother and father to suffer under the illusion that their beloved son was dead!?

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Son!? You are Hildy's father!?

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text:
Godbert the goldsmith's a Manderville man,♪
Smithing as only a Manderville can,♪
Oil him up and give him a tan,♪
Fit for a Mander-Manderville man!♪

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Please, Father, cease your undulations at once! There are more pressing matters at hand!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: This antique vase must be made whole once more, for the sake of Miss Maria!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hah! Do not worry, little one─I deal with worse cases before my morning bowel movement!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Hold your applause until the end! Byregot, guide my hammer!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Look how it sparkles in the twilight, how it radiates elegance! Would you all not agree that it is a work of art?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: You've completely destroyed a priceless antique's historical value!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Nonsense! I have taken a dull, unremarkable vase and transformed it into something far superior! I hope you were paying attention, Hildy. How long has it been since you last held a hammer?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Father, I... That is not my path. I am an agent of enquiry─an inspector! It is my duty to help those in need.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Miss Maria is one such person. There are others, too─innocent people whose weapons were callously ripped from their hands by a thieving duelist.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I thought you had put away childish dreams. No matter─you will understand in due time.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: No, I will not! I am an inspector, Father! I can be naught else!

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: Um... Mister Godbert, sir─I don't think my mother's going to like what you did. She probably won't let Mister Hildibrand help with the investigation...

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: We cannot say that for certain, can we? Mayhap she will take a liking to this...reimagining.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: You spoke of a thieving duelist, did you not? It so happens I am something of a duelist myself.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Were we to cross paths with this fellow, I would welcome the opportunity to pit my skills against his. Enkidu as well, I should think!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: I see you too possess a strong sense of justice. Full glad am I to have met you, Greg. Now, let us return to Vesper Bay and see how our vase is received.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Vesper Bay, you say? What a coincidence! I shall be traveling there on business once I have finished gathering materials.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Ho, I think I might have seen the demon bird which took my weapon! Go on without me─I shall follow anon.

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: I hope she likes it...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Mayhap Miss Maria should be the one to present the vase.

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: Mother, I brought you the vase...

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: By the gods, have you all no shame!? How dare you make my daughter complicit in your chicanery!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: I don't know where you found this gaudy trash, but it bears no resemblance whatsoever to the vase I purchased!

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Now see here, Lady Durilda! Not only did you send Maria to fetch your priceless vase alone, placing her in considerable danger should bandits or wild beasts attack─which they did─but─

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: (-???-)Gaudy trash?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: L-Lord Manderville, sir, I did not realize you had arrived!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Though I know it is nothing compared to the lavish accommodations an esteemed gentleman such as yourself must enjoy, I pray my humble abode meets with your satisfaction.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Oh, it does, my lady, it does indeed─especially that exquisite vase over yonder. Although I gather from your previous comments that you do not like my reconstruction?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Your reconstruction?

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: Ohoho, I don't like it─I love it! I would go so far as to call it the new centerpiece of my Thorne Dynasty collection!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Ah, what a relief! I would have been most distressed had you said otherwise. We Mandervilles do so take pride in our work and ever strive for professional perfection.

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: Oh, but why am I repeating what my son Hildibrand doubtless told you when he offered to investigate the duelist's threats? Enough expository banter, I say!

dialogue.name: DURILDA
dialogue.text: I-I cannot recall if your son used those precise words, but I do remember thinking that his help would be most welcome! You will be helping us, Inspector Hildibrand, will you not?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Wait a minute─your father is Lord Godbert Manderville, the man who took Eolande Quiveron's seat on the Syndicate?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: It appears there have been a great many developments over the past ten years of which I was completely unaware...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: In any case, we must redirect our energies towards the investigation of the thieving duelist!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Our first order of business will be to review all the facts with consenting Inspector Briardien.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Come, we have a thief to catch! Let us seek out Inspector Briardien at once!

dialogue.name: GODBERT
dialogue.text: I hope I did not speak overmuch earlier! My wife would describe it as a “proclivity to pontificate,” but I prefer to think of it as an earnest desire to establish rapport with my fellow man.

dialogue.name: MARIA
dialogue.text: (I think she likes it!)

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Why are you still here?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Allow me to elucidate: Lady Durilda has asked that we assist with the investigation! Now kindly share with us all your information.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Fine. Our plans have advanced to a stage that even you couldn't ruin them anyway.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: I commissioned several reproductions of the Treaty-Blade through a merchant named Jojonpa, who traffics in counterfeit antiques.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: These blades have been delivered to the Observatorium, where they are being distributed amongst Lady Durilda's sellswords. Once I give the order, they will transport them via alternate routes to Vesper Bay.

dialogue.name: NASHUMHAKARACCA
dialogue.text: Ohhh, I think I get it. You're hiding the real transport with a bunch of decoys, right?

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: They're all decoys. The moment the thief strikes, all our forces will converge on his location─including those disguised as smallfolk along each route. The real Treaty-Blade will remain in the original owner's vault until the thief has been apprehended.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Everything has been accounted for. You are superfluous.

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: ...Mayhap we could use more “smallfolk” to watch the roads in and out of the Observatorium─assuming you have the capacity to conduct yourself in an unassuming fashion.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Fear not, my fellow inspector, for I am a master of disguise! Have you any information regarding the duelist himself? A description?

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: You never thought to ask Humphrey, did you? <sigh> The thief is said to be a towering brute dressed in red who wields a halberd.

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hah hah hah! A man so garishly dressed should be easy to find in snowy Coerthas!

dialogue.name: BRIARDIEN
dialogue.text: Then I suppose we don't need your help, after all, do we? Come or don't─I couldn't care less.

dialogue.name: ELLIE
dialogue.text: Be seeing you.

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: Pray forgive my lateness!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Greg, my good man! What a pleasure to see you again! We just received new information regarding the weapon thief!

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A victim described him as a halberd-wielding brute dressed in...dressed in...

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: A ridiculous outfit!

dialogue.name: GILGAMESH
dialogue.text: A ridiculous outfit? Ho, now I am intrigued. What reasons would a warrior have for wearing impractical clothing?

dialogue.name: HILDIBRAND
dialogue.text: Hah hah, what reasons indeed? It is enough to make a gentleman laugh!
